com.canabang.genietext.core.controller
Class Controller

java.lang.Object
  com.canabang.genietext.core.controller.Controller

public class Controller
extends Object

Entry-point in the system. Initializes service. Services can be started either by passing input XML files into the constructor as an array, or by calling the startService() method on demand. The view of this MVC controller should call the startService() method to start a service with the parameters given by the user.

Version:
1.00 2009-05-12 Initial submission., 1.10 2009-05-31 Now only deals with SmsServiceProvider objects so that multiple services can be instantiated simultaneously in a more object oriented manner. Time military format control feature added. No longer works with ConnectionInfo, but rather Parameters objects and input files.
Author:
rhaq

Constructor Detail

Controller

public Controller()
Starts the view reference of this MVC model and waits for inputs from the view to start the desired services.

Controller

public Controller(String[] inputFiles)
Creates an instance of this class and processes the input files specified by calling the model reference of the MVC pattern. This method of starting the program does not interact with the view at all except to dump out error messages.

Parameters:
inputFiles - The input files containing the parameters needed to start services to be processed by the model.
Method Detail

startService

public static SmsServiceProvider startService(Parameters p)
                                       throws TransformerConfigurationException,
                                              MessagingException
Starts the service with the specified parameters.

Parameters:
p - The parameters required to start the service.
Returns:
An instance of the service started.
Throws:
MessagingException - If there is a problem connecting to the remote service or in the event that the server could not authenticate the connection or the required folder(s) could not be opened/accessed.
TransformerConfigurationException - If an output XML file could not be properly configured and set up to output the subscription list.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
Primary-entry point in the system.

Parameters:
args - List of input files containing the parameters of the services to start.
